snippet.textDisplay: I really liked this game, and I liked that each character had a style of music that corresponded to them. It made them feel more unique. Rouge's music was usually my favorite.

snippet.textDisplay:
I dunno why everybody's dogging on the lyrics, I like they way they're unique and creates these images in your mind.
"Once it was a coal pit but now it's a water ride".
"I'm in narrow hallways. running like it's a ballgame"? That line describes my busy school life so perfectly, in fact I think that line whenever I'm rushing from class to class on the campus, lol.
snippet.textOriginal:
I dunno why everybody's dogging on the lyrics, I like they way they're unique and creates these images in your mind.

"I'm in narrow hallways. running like it's a ballgame"? That line describes my busy school life so perfectly, in fact I think that line whenever I'm rushing from class to class on the campus, lol.

snippet.textDisplay: This game came out before I became a fan of rap music. Back then I disliked the fact that they used rap for Knuckles' stages. Despite that, I still couldn't bring myself to hate this song back then. It's the kind of rap song that almost anyone could enjoy.

snippet.textDisplay: I consider Sonic Adventure 2 the last reasonably good Sonic game. It was flawed in some important ways, but it was still worth playing. The soundtrack on the game was very good (Live and Learn, anyone?). In fact, about the only thing about recent Sonic titles that I would say has been consistently good is the music.
snippet.textOriginal: I consider Sonic Adventure 2 the last reasonably good Sonic game. It was flawed in some important ways, but it was still worth playing. The soundtrack on the game was very good (Live and Learn, anyone?). In fact, about the only thing about recent Sonic titles that I would say has been consistently good is the music.

snippet.textDisplay:
When it comes to modern Sonic-games, I haven't liked any of the games since Sonic Heroes (but that wasn't really a Sonic-game, more like a 3d-platformer). But I really enjoy the clipscenes in all the games.
Oh well, I got Sonic Generations today, let's see if it was worth it
snippet.textOriginal:

Oh well, I got Sonic Generations today, let's see if it was worth it

snippet.textDisplay: I feel like the Sonic Adventure games get dismissed too often for being just another 3D sonic game. Honestly, I thought they were pretty damn good, especially for the time (I've gone back and played SA1 and 2, and I will say that 2 has aged better than SA1...). I also did always like the chill hip-hop beats that the knuckles levels got.
snippet.textOriginal: I feel like the Sonic Adventure games get dismissed too often for being just another 3D sonic game. Honestly, I thought they were pretty damn good, especially for the time (I've gone back and played SA1 and 2, and I will say that 2 has aged better than SA1...). I also did always like the chill hip-hop beats that the knuckles levels got.

snippet.textDisplay: I have to admit that the chaos emerald hunting stages weren't my cup of tea, aside from piloting knuckles and some of the songs. This was a standout in terms of ambiance I guess. My personal favorite track will always be Biolizard battle part 1's theme.
snippet.textOriginal: I have to admit that the chaos emerald hunting stages weren't my cup of tea, aside from piloting knuckles and some of the songs. This was a standout in terms of ambiance I guess. My personal favorite track will always be Biolizard battle part 1's theme.

snippet.textDisplay: Considering SupraDarky's fan followers I was expecting a lot of unjustified hate towards Sonic, or at least hate of modern games from retro fans in the comment section. I'm glad to see that's not the case :)

snippet.textDisplay:
SA I preferred the gameplay.
And while I like a lot of the soundtracks, I find it hard to argue with SA2 having the best, if not one of the best Sonic soundtracks. City Escape, Metal Harbor, Radical Highway, Eggman's theme, Pumpkin Hill, Aquatic Mine, Meteor Herd, the one that against the BioLizard, Live & Learn are my favs.
snippet.textOriginal:
SA I preferred the gameplay.
And while I like a lot of the soundtracks, I find it hard to argue with SA2 having the best, if not one of the best Sonic soundtracks. City Escape, Metal Harbor, Radical Highway, Eggman's theme, Pumpkin Hill, Aquatic Mine, Meteor Herd, the one that against the BioLizard, Live & Learn are my favs.

snippet.textDisplay: Well this one's a guilty pleasure. I've already said I've never been a fan of most 3D Sonic games (except the last couples ones that seem nice), and that includes the way Sonic has been portrayed, trying to be cool and all. I really don't like that. Still, I heard this song 10 years ago and I remember it quite well, and I like the instruments.
snippet.textOriginal: Well this one's a guilty pleasure. I've already said I've never been a fan of most 3D Sonic games (except the last couples ones that seem nice), and that includes the way Sonic has been portrayed, trying to be cool and all. I really don't like that. Still, I heard this song 10 years ago and I remember it quite well, and I like the instruments.
